Package com.j2bugzilla.base

This package contains the base classes required by the library to communicate with a Bugzilla installation.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    BugzillaMethod
    This interface defines the methods an object must provide to be executed as a remote method on a Bugzilla installation via XML-RPC.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Attachment
    The Attachment class defines certain shared properties of files attached to a bug report.
    AttachmentFactory
    The AttachmentFactory is responsible for creating new Attachment objects based off of data from either a Bugzilla installation or user input.
    Bug
    This class encapsulates all information about a bug report posted on a Bugzilla installation.
    BugFactory
    The BugFactory class allows users of the j2bugzilla API to construct new Bugs using a fluent interface.
    BugzillaConnector
    The BugzillaConnector class handles all access to a given Bugzilla installation.
    Comment
    The Comment class represents a comment entered for a particular Bug in a Bugzilla installation.
    Flag
    The Flag class represents a custom flag in a Bugzilla installation.
    Product
    A Product object represents a product category on the Bugzilla installation.
    ProductVersion
    A ProductVersion object represents a version of a product category on the Bugzilla installation.
    XmlExceptionHandler
    The XmlExceptionHandler provides a static utility method for translating generic XmlRpcExceptions into subclasses of BugzillaException to be handled by the client code.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Flag.Status
    The Status enum represents the current state of a Flag.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    BugzillaException
    A BugzillaException indicates that Bugzilla has returned a fault rather than the expected return value for a method.
    ConnectionException
    ConnectionException is thrown any time there is an error trying to access the Bugzilla installation over the network.

Package com.j2bugzilla.base Description

This package contains the base classes required by the library to communicate with a Bugzilla installation. For example, the Bug class is defined here, to provide a useful data object for encapsulating the pertinent values of a bug report. The entry point for accessing a remote Bugzilla installation, BugzillaConnector, is also provided here. This package further includes the BugzillaMethod interface, which allows implementing classes to execute methods defined in the Bugzilla XML-RPC API. Finally, this package contains the XmlExceptionHandler for translating the Apache XmlRpcException objects to a descriptive BugzillaException based on the returned fault code.

To begin using this library, a BugzillaConnector object must be created and used to connect to a remote instance. For example, one would use the following code snippet to connect to the sample Landfill installation:

BugzillaConnector conn = new BugzillaConnector();
conn.connectTo("https://landfill.bugzilla.org/bugzilla-tip/");
The connectTo method will attempt to connect to the /xmlrpc.cgi endpoint of the provided URL; this can also be directly appended to the URL string. If a connection cannot be established, a ConnectionException is thrown with an appropriate message.

Once a connection has been established, classes which implement BugzillaMethod may be passed to the BugzillaConnector#executeMethod(BugzillaMethod) method. For example, to authenticate with the server, one would write the following:

BugzillaMethod logIn = new LogIn("user@sample.com", "somepass");
try {
conn.executeMethod(logIn);
} catch(BugzillaException e) {
e.printStackTrace();
}
If the returned XML document includes a fault code, a BugzillaException will be thrown from executeMethod.
